Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: christine j
Reviews.Content: Pulled off the interstate to rest for the night. It was cleaner than expected and quiet. Beds were also plush and comfy, so I had a good night's rest. Front desk even gave me a late check out when I asked for it at 11am :) they were very understanding and professional.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sarah a
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights had a good stay....Checked in about 1 hour early with problem at all and checked out later then normal check out time with no issues...Staff was friendly..Pool is very small...Great location!! We go to Daytona very often but never have stayed here...Planning to visit again real soon....

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous...not horrible.”
Reviews.Author: pookiegf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on July 2, 2012. The room was average, although it needs some work and could have been cleaned better. Check in was ok but they did put an additional hold on my card for 120 dollars above room cost which is ridiculous. Breakfast was sufficient but dont expect alot. My biggest complaint is that the desk clerk ( a female) spent all her time on the bench outside smoking so if you go to the desk for something you have to wait awhile and no one at the desk ever seemed to answer the phone!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay was much better”
Reviews.Author: Jon14-6
Reviews.Content: Stayed back in January, and they had some issues at this Comfort Suites. I called Choice Hotels and told them of the problems we had, and a few days later I received an e-mail from the manager stating that these issues had been fixed. So last week we stayed for one night on our way to Port Canaveral for a cruise. I didn't have to kick the door to get in to my room anymore (that's a good thing!), the shower had a metal sprayer (not plastic), but the tv is still an old crt style with fuzzy channels. But when you're staying only one night, that's not a big issue with us. Breakfast area was fully stocked, and had scrambled eggs, bacon, make-your-own waffles. When we checked out, the guy at the front desk asked how our stay was, and I told him it was good. Check-in and check-out was quick.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay or you will PAY”
Reviews.Author: chubbyshark
Reviews.Content: Their is a thief in this hotel. Specialized idem for my handicapped wife was taken from our bathroom. The manager on duty said he couldn't believe us and offered no restitution. The idem that was stolen is used every day by my wife and was in the bathroom when we left our locked room for the morning. On return the idem was gone. Very noisy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THESE SCAM ARTISTS”
Reviews.Author: MS34609
Reviews.Content: The only positive I can say is that the room was not terrible. The staff was horrible, rude is such and understatement!!! These ladies, and they do NOT deserve such a nice word, could not have been nastier or trashier. Bad language and didnt even pay any attention to what they were doing at check in. Waited to check out because there was a problem with the room. Stood at the counter for almost 10 minutes before anybody even came, then the lady came over asked "checking out?" took my keys for the room threw them on the counter and walked away.As if this all wasnt bad enough, I check out and they charged my card an additional $120! They claim it is a deposit that will reverse in a few days. This was not stated on the paperwork anywhere!I callled the hotel to try to find out why this additional money was charged to me and the RUDE manager, Sam Patel, actually had the nerve to hang up on me. I left a message for him, waited all day and never received a call back. Then when I do get through to him he has the nerve to hang up on me and refuse to explain the charge.These people are BAD news!!! There are plenty of other hotel choices... go to ANY other hotel in Daytona. They will rip you off and treat you like trash.If all of this is not bad enough, there is a TON of road noise from the traffic; the public bathroom in the loby was filthy, with boxes of tampons all over the shelves, no hand soap and no paper towels. The pool was dirty. There is NO water pressure in the showers, toilets or sink. The a/c didnt work properly. The carpets were dirty.Seriously, stay away from this nightmare!! It looks nice on the surface, but thats as far as it goes.Cons: Noisy, Poor breakfast, rude, dirty, over charged, no water pressure, insufficient parking when they are full, hard to get into and out of

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Criminals.”
Reviews.Author: Daw1
Reviews.Content: I had a room scheduled on march 10th 2012, due to a change in plans, I called to cancel my reservation two days prior to our reservation. The hotel has a 24 hour cancelation rule. I called well before that rule took effect. I was tol by a staff member that nobody was available to cancel my reservation, and that I should call back the next day. When I called back the next day, I was told that I would now be charged for the room because it was within the 24 hour period. I was again told to contact the hotel later in the evening to speek to the manager. When I called, I explained my situation, and was told that there was nothing they could do and that I should call choice hotels and speek to customer relations. After spending nearly 40 minutes on the phone, I was told I would have to wait 3 days for a response to my complaint. Three days passed and I heard nothing. I called back and was told that the general manager had emailed me. I had no emails and ha even confirmed the email address. I asked them to re-send it, an Recieved nothing. I attempted to call the general manager, but was unable to speek to him because the front desk staff rudely refused to transfer the call. I still have not Recieved a response. Avoid frustrations. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Speedweeks friday”
Reviews.Author: neptunenavigator
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel many times over the past four years for business purposes, and have always found it rather average. What sets this off was that they were charging $400 per night and yet could not provide basic breakfast service above what I normally encounter. This hotel has never been attentive to the breakfast portion of the day. On Saturday morning, they ran out of coffee and the basic food items by 8:30 am. Typically I will ignore this during my $69 stays, but at $400? The hotel has not been refreshed during the past four years, though once the manager was excited that they were cleaning the carpet in 2011. The beds are clean, as well as the bathrooom. It is an average hotel, that gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: “good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: dlynette
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after the Daytona 500 got rained out on Sunday and we needed to stay an extra night. We booked the room on the website so we got a great price, I am unsure if the price would have been as low if we booked at the desk since every hotel was jacking up the prices for the extra day of the daytona. the room was clean and nice, but did have many stains on the furniture and carpets as someone else stated in a previous review. I would take this hotel any day over the La Quinta right beside it,that we stayed in the night before. It was terrible. Overall I like this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dpopester
Reviews.Content: Although this is a lovely hotel, there are definite problems. If you are looking for a business center, don't stay here. Nothing in their business center worked. This hotel held nearly $400.00 on my debit card for a one night stay. I signed the check in form for a room cost of $59.95 per night. When I checked my account the next morning there were all kinds of charges on my card totaling $286.45. When we checked out, I was presented a bill for $67.45, which was held on my card in addition to the $286.45. After I arrived home, I checked my account again and there were $217.45 in charges. I questioned this and was told it was because we smoked in the room. We had our special needs granddaughter with us. She is not able to tolerate smoke. We had made several trips outside to smoke and were seen doing so. I guess they charge you a fee at this hotel if you smoke at all, even on the outside. I asked how in the world they could say that and was told that the night auditor smelled smoke when he put our bill under the door. Since there was no bill under our door I guess that is the standard lie. THEY WILL NEVER GET ANOTHER DIME FROM ME AND I HOPE THAT ALL SMOKERS WILL BOYCOTT THIS LOCATION. The hotel was nearly empty during this stay which was at the beginning of Speed Weeks 2012 and Presidents day 2012. What a shame. I would rather stay in a dump and be treated fairly than to stay here under these conditions. I will tell you that we left this hotel after only one night and checked into a Clarion Hotel and were more than pleased with the service there. So, unless you want to have someone play with your money at will, then do not stay at his hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Comfort Suites I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Jon14-6
Reviews.Content: Being a choice hotel member for a couple of years, I usually stay at a Comfort Suites when I'm on vacation. Got to this one, and checked in with no problems. Staff was friendly. Got to my room, and the door wouldn't open. It started to open, but it was like a chain was hooked on the inside. So I wondered if there was someone inside. So I went and got someone from the front desk to help me out. The guy that came back with me bascially shoved the door "hard" to get it open. Every other time I went into the room, I kicked the bottom of the door to get in. An older couple came walking by me the next morning, and saw me kicking the bottom of the door to open it, and they said their door was the same way. Room was clean with a huge king bed. TV was the old CRT model, with limited channels that were fuzzy. No History or Discovery Channel (my favorites!) Got to the shower, and the shower head was plastic. When I tried to adjust it (spray to massage), it started squirting out the side. I then noticed it had a big crack down the side of it. Went to use the computer in the buisness center, and it was very slow. At one point during breakfast the next morning, trash was piled over the top of the trash can located in the breakfast area. The lady suppling the breakfast area was busy. Maybe she was just overwhelmed that morning. A big group of cheerleaders were there, and the breakfast area was packed. I really hate to say it, but out of all the Comfort Suites I've stayed at, this one was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: I think this is a good hotel but needs some work. The carpet has a lot of large stains and there is never anyone at the front desk. The breakfast not much to choose from and know one around to refil it so you better be down there at 6. It is a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sher222
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels in Daytona, next to racetrack in middle of all the restaurants. Rooms have wet bars, sofa, and comfortable beds. We have stayed there several times and if you don't want to be on beach it is one of the best values and locations in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Needs deep clean”
Reviews.Author: davidcpo
Reviews.Content: Although the location was ideal for our trip, the hotel was in need of some deep cleaning. The hall carpets were soiled. Our room had mold on the wall and carpet under the air conditioner. Also the marble around the tub was showing a water problem behind it with mold along grout lines. The front desk staff was not attentive to the needs in the breakfast room and the chairs in that area were stained. My wife and I were very disappointed. We have noticed several other comfort properties are in the same need of attention..

Reviews.Title: “Better than not bad stop for a night”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to a 6AM flt out of Daytonna driven by high fares at Orlando and I was really satisfied considering the rate. The staff was friendly and helpful - even dealing with the throng of teens hogging the business center so I could print out my boarding pass. The room was clean - albeit a bit worn - but way cleaner than the Holiday Inn Express I had just come from in Orlando. Definitely OK for what I was doing - taking a pre-flight nap.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this place but....”
Reviews.Author: travelbound46
Reviews.Content: there was a tornado warning and thunderstorms coming our way as we travelled to the Tampa area so we stopped at this comfort suite to wait it out. luckily they had a room available and the cost was really good. the hotel reception clerk sam was extremely nice and courteous. the lobby was small but appeared clean. we checked in then went to our room. when we opened the door there was quite an odor in the room. i can't quite exlain it. it wasnt repulsive but it wasnt pleasant either. smelled like old rug or they needed to clean the bed linen. the walls, bed linen and rugs had strange spots on them and I don't even want to guess what they were! the room is big and well lighted to it's benefit. I cant imagine that they will be cleaning up their rooms anytime soon since it is such a great deal and it's right down the road from the speedway. i'm sure they'll never run out of business but it would be nice if they could do something to make it less smelly!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Race weekend”
Reviews.Author: cmartin78
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for the Daytona 500. We had a King suite and our room was great. The place was very clean and had a nice breakfast in the mornings. Comfortable beds, nice bathrooms. Looked just like the pictures on the site. The staff was very helpful in suggesting places to eat, very chatty and very friendly. They let us park our truck there Sunday even after we checked out so we didn't have to fuss with track parking. Planning on staying there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money staying here”
Reviews.Author: aussiehjk
Reviews.Content: The sign to the entrance of this hotel sets the scene for whats to come literally. When you enter the lobby there is a smell, that's through the whole building. According to the staff member who checked us in this is a relatively new hotel. Could have fooled me. This hotel looks like something from the 70's. The carpet is old and very dirty. Spots everywhere. We asked to see a room before we signed in. It looked OK but it was very plain. The great value for money touted on the sign to the entrance is a joke. If you are a business traveler, forget this place, the internet sucks. There is no wireless and the wired internet was not much better. Our check in staff member tried hard but fell short. The coffee maker in our room just didn't work and apparently there was either a shortage of toilet paper when the rooms were cleaned or they were rationing it because we had to ask for it!!! The bed was uncomfortable and the place was noisy, even although there were not many people staying. I would prefer to pay $200 a night than stay in this place again. I got the distinct impression these people think that you are honored by their presence.

Reviews.Title: “Good area but the hotel service was extremely poor”
Reviews.Author: LadyC7500
Reviews.Content: Located around good restaurants and close to the Daytona 500. The hotel is behind a gas station and the place was safe. The employees were nonchalant and they had a I don't care that you are here attitude. The room was big and seemed cleaned until you look at the carpet, black stains everywhere!!. I mean stains everywhere you look!!. The breakfast is your regular waffle, sausage, coffee, cereal, bagels, fruit, yogurt and things of that nature however there was no one attending to the breakfast area so when they ran out you were out of luck. Some other guests tried to ring the bell so they could come and tend to the area but from 6-9am no one ever came!!. Other than the pool was clean and housekeeping and maintenance guy were nice and that's all !! Would never go back again!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Mars061
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with a small child. The room was very big, plenty of space for a crib. Very clean too. Kitchen area. Plenty of stores and restaurants nearby. Friendly personnel. Nice breakfast. Only thing that was disappointing was that the pool was freezing. But, they didn't advertise with a heated pool so fair is fair, we could have known.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 90 Professional Boulevard, Daytona Beach, FL 32114
